00048 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00049 // Classes and helpers for the extension mechanism
00050 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00051 // Helper function:
00052 SC_API unsigned int max_num_extensions();
00053 
00054 // This class can be used for storing pointers to the extension classes, used
00055 // in tlm_generic_payload:
00056 class SC_API tlm_extension_base
00057 {
00058 public:
00059     virtual tlm_extension_base* clone() const = 0;
00060     virtual void free() { delete this; }
00061     virtual void copy_from(tlm_extension_base const &) = 0;
00062 protected:
00063     virtual ~tlm_extension_base() {}
00064     static unsigned int register_extension(const std::type_info&);
00065 };
00066 
00067 // Base class for all extension classes, derive your extension class in
00068 // the following way:
00069 // class my_extension : public tlm_extension<my_extension> { ...
00070 // This triggers proper extension registration during C++ static
00071 // contruction time. my_extension::ID will hold the unique index in the
00072 // tlm_generic_payload::m_extensions array.
00073 template <typename T>
00074 class tlm_extension : public tlm_extension_base
00075 {
00076 public:
00077     virtual tlm_extension_base* clone() const = 0;
00078     virtual void copy_from(tlm_extension_base const &ext) = 0;
00079     virtual ~tlm_extension() {}
00080     const static unsigned int ID;
00081 };
00082 
00083 template <typename T>
00084 const unsigned int tlm_extension<T>::ID
00085   = tlm_extension_base::register_extension(typeid(T));
00086

00088 // enumeration types
00089 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00090 enum tlm_command {
00091     TLM_READ_COMMAND,
00092     TLM_WRITE_COMMAND,
00093     TLM_IGNORE_COMMAND
00094 };
00095 
00096 enum tlm_response_status {
00097     TLM_OK_RESPONSE = 1,
00098     TLM_INCOMPLETE_RESPONSE = 0,
00099     TLM_GENERIC_ERROR_RESPONSE = -1,
00100     TLM_ADDRESS_ERROR_RESPONSE = -2,
00101     TLM_COMMAND_ERROR_RESPONSE = -3,
00102     TLM_BURST_ERROR_RESPONSE = -4,
00103     TLM_BYTE_ENABLE_ERROR_RESPONSE = -5
00104 };
00105 
00106 enum tlm_gp_option {
00107     TLM_MIN_PAYLOAD,
00108     TLM_FULL_PAYLOAD,
00109     TLM_FULL_PAYLOAD_ACCEPTED
00110 };
00111 
00112 #define TLM_BYTE_DISABLED 0x0
00113 #define TLM_BYTE_ENABLED 0xff

00115 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00116 // The generic payload class:
00117 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------

00119 SC_API_TEMPLATE_DECL_ tlm_array<tlm_extension_base*>;
00120 
00121 class SC_API tlm_generic_payload {
00122 
00123 public:
00124     //---------------
00125     // Constructors
00126     //---------------
00127 
00128     // Default constructor
00129     tlm_generic_payload();
00130     explicit tlm_generic_payload(tlm_mm_interface* mm);
00131 
00132     void acquire() { sc_assert(m_mm != 0); m_ref_count++; }
00133 
00134     void release() {
00135         sc_assert(m_mm != 0 && m_ref_count > 0);
00136         if (--m_ref_count==0)
00137             m_mm->free(this);
00138     }
00139 
00140     int get_ref_count() const { return m_ref_count; }
00141 
00142     void set_mm(tlm_mm_interface* mm) { m_mm = mm; }
00143     bool has_mm() const { return m_mm != 0; }
00144 
00145     void reset();
00146 
00147 private:
00148     //disabled copy ctor and assignment operator.
00149     tlm_generic_payload(const tlm_generic_payload& x) /* = delete */;
00150     tlm_generic_payload& operator= (const tlm_generic_payload& x) /* = delete */;
00151 
00152 public:
00153     // non-virtual deep-copying of the object
00154     void deep_copy_from(const tlm_generic_payload & other);
00155 
00156     // To update the state of the original generic payload from a deep copy
00157     // Assumes that "other" was created from the original by calling deep_copy_from
00158     // Argument use_byte_enable_on_read determines whether to use or ignores byte enables
00159     // when copying back the data array on a read command
00160 
00161     void update_original_from(const tlm_generic_payload & other,
00162                               bool use_byte_enable_on_read = true);
00163 
00164     void update_extensions_from(const tlm_generic_payload & other);
00165 
00166     // Free all extensions. Useful when reusing a cloned transaction that doesn't have memory manager.
00167     // normal and sticky extensions are freed and extension array cleared.
00168     void free_all_extensions();
00169 
00170     //--------------
00171     // Destructor
00172     //--------------
00173     virtual ~tlm_generic_payload();
00174 
00175     //----------------
00176     // API (including setters & getters)
00177     //---------------
00178 
00179     // Command related method
00180     bool                 is_read() const {return (m_command == TLM_READ_COMMAND);}
00181     void                 set_read() {m_command = TLM_READ_COMMAND;}
00182     bool                 is_write() const {return (m_command == TLM_WRITE_COMMAND);}
00183     void                 set_write() {m_command = TLM_WRITE_COMMAND;}
00184     tlm_command          get_command() const {return m_command;}
00185     void                 set_command(const tlm_command command) {m_command = command;}
00186 
00187     // Address related methods
00188     sc_dt::uint64        get_address() const {return m_address;}
00189     void                 set_address(const sc_dt::uint64 address) {m_address = address;}
00190 
00191     // Data related methods
00192     unsigned char*       get_data_ptr() const {return m_data;}
00193     void                 set_data_ptr(unsigned char* data) {m_data = data;}
00194 
00195     // Transaction length (in bytes) related methods
00196     unsigned int         get_data_length() const {return m_length;}
00197     void                 set_data_length(const unsigned int length) {m_length = length;}
00198 
00199     // Response status related methods
00200     bool                 is_response_ok() const {return (m_response_status > 0);}
00201     bool                 is_response_error() const {return (m_response_status <= 0);}
00202     tlm_response_status  get_response_status() const {return m_response_status;}
00203     void                 set_response_status(const tlm_response_status response_status)
00204         {m_response_status = response_status;}
00205     std::string          get_response_string() const;
00206 
00207     // Streaming related methods
00208     unsigned int         get_streaming_width() const {return m_streaming_width;}
00209     void                 set_streaming_width(const unsigned int streaming_width) {m_streaming_width = streaming_width; }
00210 
00211     // Byte enable related methods
00212     unsigned char*       get_byte_enable_ptr() const {return m_byte_enable;}
00213     void                 set_byte_enable_ptr(unsigned char* byte_enable){m_byte_enable = byte_enable;}
00214     unsigned int         get_byte_enable_length() const {return m_byte_enable_length;}
00215     void                 set_byte_enable_length(const unsigned int byte_enable_length){m_byte_enable_length = byte_enable_length;}
00216 
00217     // This is the "DMI-hint" a slave can set this to true if it
00218     // wants to indicate that a DMI request would be supported:
00219     void                 set_dmi_allowed(bool dmi_allowed) { m_dmi = dmi_allowed; }
00220     bool                 is_dmi_allowed() const { return m_dmi; }
00221 
00222     // Use full set of attributes in DMI/debug?
00223     tlm_gp_option get_gp_option() const { return m_gp_option; }
00224     void          set_gp_option( const tlm_gp_option gp_opt ) { m_gp_option = gp_opt; }
00225 
00226 private:
00227 
00228     /* --------------------------------------------------------------------- */
00229     /* Generic Payload attributes:                                           */
00230     /* --------------------------------------------------------------------- */
00231     /* - m_command         : Type of transaction. Three values supported:    */
00232     /*                       - TLM_WRITE_COMMAND                             */
00233     /*                       - TLM_READ_COMMAND                              */
00234     /*                       - TLM_IGNORE_COMMAND                            */
00235     /* - m_address         : Transaction base address (byte-addressing).     */
00236     /* - m_data            : When m_command = TLM_WRITE_COMMAND contains a   */
00237     /*                       pointer to the data to be written in the target.*/
00238     /*                       When m_command = TLM_READ_COMMAND contains a    */
00239     /*                       pointer where to copy the data read from the    */
00240     /*                       target.                                         */
00241     /* - m_length          : Total number of bytes of the transaction.       */
00242     /* - m_response_status : This attribute indicates whether an error has   */
00243     /*                       occurred during the transaction.                */
00244     /*                       Values supported are:                           */
00245     /*                       - TLM_OK_RESP                                   */
00246     /*                       - TLM_INCOMPLETE_RESP                           */
00247     /*                       - TLM_GENERIC_ERROR_RESP                        */
00248     /*                       - TLM_ADDRESS_ERROR_RESP                        */
00249     /*                       - TLM_COMMAND_ERROR_RESP                        */
00250     /*                       - TLM_BURST_ERROR_RESP                          */
00251     /*                       - TLM_BYTE_ENABLE_ERROR_RESP                    */
00252     /*                                                                       */
00253     /* - m_byte_enable     : It can be used to create burst transfers where  */
00254     /*                    the address increment between each beat is greater */
00255     /*                    than the word length of each beat, or to place     */
00256     /*                    words in selected byte lanes of a bus.             */
00257     /* - m_byte_enable_length : For a read or a write command, the target    */
00258     /*                    interpret the byte enable length attribute as the  */
00259     /*                    number of elements in the bytes enable array.      */
00260     /* - m_streaming_width  :                                                */
00261     /* --------------------------------------------------------------------- */
00262 
00263     sc_dt::uint64        m_address;
00264     tlm_command          m_command;
00265     unsigned char*       m_data;
00266     unsigned int         m_length;
00267     tlm_response_status  m_response_status;
00268     bool                 m_dmi;
00269     unsigned char*       m_byte_enable;
00270     unsigned int         m_byte_enable_length;
00271     unsigned int         m_streaming_width;
00272     tlm_gp_option        m_gp_option;
00273 
00274 public:
00275 
00276     /* --------------------------------------------------------------------- */
00277     /* Dynamic extension mechanism:                                          */
00278     /* --------------------------------------------------------------------- */
00279     /* The extension mechanism is intended to enable initiator modules to    */
00280     /* optionally and transparently add data fields to the                   */
00281     /* tlm_generic_payload. Target modules are free to check for extensions  */
00282     /* and may or may not react to the data in the extension fields. The     */
00283     /* definition of the extensions' semantics is solely in the              */
00284     /* responsibility of the user.                                           */
00285     /*                                                                       */
00286     /* The following rules apply:                                            */
00287     /*                                                                       */
00288     /* - Every extension class must be derived from tlm_extension, e.g.:     */
00289     /*     class my_extension : public tlm_extension<my_extension> { ... }   */
00290     /*                                                                       */
00291     /* - A tlm_generic_payload object should be constructed after C++        */
00292     /*   static initialization time. This way it is guaranteed that the      */
00293     /*   extension array is of sufficient size to hold all possible          */
00294     /*   extensions. Alternatively, the initiator module can enforce a valid */
00295     /*   extension array size by calling the resize_extensions() method      */
00296     /*   once before the first transaction with the payload object is        */
00297     /*   initiated.                                                          */
00298     /*                                                                       */
00299     /* - Initiators should use the the set_extension(e) or clear_extension(e)*/
00300     /*   methods for manipulating the extension array. The type of the       */
00301     /*   argument must be a pointer to the specific registered extension     */
00302     /*   type (my_extension in the above example) and is used to             */
00303     /*   automatically locate the appropriate index in the array.            */
00304     /*                                                                       */
00305     /* - Targets can check for a specific extension by calling               */
00306     /*   get_extension(e). e will point to zero if the extension is not      */
00307     /*   present.                                                            */
00308     /*                                                                       */
00309     /* --------------------------------------------------------------------- */
00310 
00311     // Stick the pointer to an extension into the vector, return the
00312     // previous value:
00313     template <typename T> T* set_extension(T* ext)
00314     {
00315         return static_cast<T*>(set_extension(T::ID, ext));
00316     }
00317 
00318     // non-templatized version with manual index:
00319     tlm_extension_base* set_extension(unsigned int index,
00320                                       tlm_extension_base* ext);
00321 
00322     // Stick the pointer to an extension into the vector, return the
00323     // previous value and schedule its release
00324     template <typename T> T* set_auto_extension(T* ext)
00325     {
00326         return static_cast<T*>(set_auto_extension(T::ID, ext));
00327     }
00328 
00329     // non-templatized version with manual index:
00330     tlm_extension_base* set_auto_extension(unsigned int index,
00331                                            tlm_extension_base* ext);
00332 
00333     // Check for an extension, ext will point to 0 if not present
00334     template <typename T> void get_extension(T*& ext) const
00335     {
00336         ext = get_extension<T>();
00337     }
00338     template <typename T> T* get_extension() const
00339     {
00340         return static_cast<T*>(get_extension(T::ID));
00341     }
00342     // Non-templatized version with manual index:
00343     tlm_extension_base* get_extension(unsigned int index) const;
00344 
00345     //this call just removes the extension from the txn but does not
00346     // call free() or tells the MM to do so
00347     // it return false if there was active MM so you are now in an unsafe situation
00348     // recommended use: when 100% sure there is no MM
00349     template <typename T> void clear_extension(const T* ext)
00350     {
00351         clear_extension<T>();
00352     }
00353 
00354     //this call just removes the extension from the txn but does not
00355     // call free() or tells the MM to do so
00356     // it return false if there was active MM so you are now in an unsafe situation
00357     // recommended use: when 100% sure there is no MM
00358     template <typename T> void clear_extension()
00359     {
00360         clear_extension(T::ID);
00361     }
00362 
00363     //this call removes the extension from the txn and does
00364     // call free() or tells the MM to do so when the txn is finally done
00365     // recommended use: when not sure there is no MM
00366     template <typename T> void release_extension(T* ext)
00367     {
00368         release_extension<T>();
00369     }
00370 
00371     //this call removes the extension from the txn and does
00372     // call free() or tells the MM to do so when the txn is finally done
00373     // recommended use: when not sure there is no MM
00374     template <typename T> void release_extension()
00375     {
00376         release_extension(T::ID);
00377     }
00378 
00379 private:
00380     // Non-templatized version with manual index
00381     void clear_extension(unsigned int index);
00382     // Non-templatized version with manual index
00383     void release_extension(unsigned int index);
00384 
00385 public:
00386     // Make sure the extension array is large enough. Can be called once by
00387     // an initiator module (before issuing the first transaction) to make
00388     // sure that the extension array is of correct size. This is only needed
00389     // if the initiator cannot guarantee that the generic payload object is
00390     // allocated after C++ static construction time.
00391     void resize_extensions();
00392 
00393 private:
00394     tlm_array<tlm_extension_base*> m_extensions;
00395     tlm_mm_interface*              m_mm;
00396     unsigned int                   m_ref_count;
00397 };
00398 
00399 } // namespace tlm
